narrative.title: 1St South African Division - 1941Q4
narrative.situation: British Commonwealth Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1941Q4.
narrative.objectives: Commonwealth infantry division organized on British model. Primarily infantry assault role with limited mobility. Brigades deployed for both offensive and defensive operations during Operation Crusader.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: coastal plain transitioning to rocky desert inland

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Experienced in desert warfare from East African Campaign
Good integration with British 8th Army command structure
Locally-produced Marmon-Herrington armored cars for reconnaissance

environment.terrain_type: coastal plain transitioning to rocky desert inland
